types.html:
dos-à-dos (invariable)

  1. (literally) back to back

types.section:
{{fr-noun|m}}

# a move in [[square dancing]] in which two dancers face each other, then step forward and left until they have right shoulders adjacent, then move to a position where they are back to back, then move to have left shoulders adjacent, then return to facing each other
types.html:
dos-à-dos m (plural dos-à-dos)

  1. a move in square dancing in which two dancers face each other, then step forward and left until they have right shoulders adjacent, then move to a position where they are back to back, then move to have left shoulders adjacent, then return to facing each other
trans: a move in square dancing in which two dancers face each other, then step forward and left until they have right shoulders adjacent, then move to a position where they are back to back, then move to have left shoulders adjacent, then return to facing each other

title: dos-à-dos
pronunHtml: • IPA(key): /do.za.do/
